summary: Phil3 community platform with consensus meeting feature that needs majority-based consensus detection fix, and bilingual (fr, en) homepage implementation
architectural_notes: Consensus meetings use group-based ranking system where participants rank contributions from first to last place
Rankings are submitted as ordered arrays of user IDs (e.g., [User1, User2, User3, User4])
Current consensus logic requires 100% agreement but should check for majority agreement within each group
Groups are assigned during Sign-up phase (max 6/group, min 3/group)
REP distribution uses Fibonacci-based logic; PHIL rewards are proportional to REP
known_issues: Consensus detection fails when 3/4 participants submit matching ranks - requires 100% agreement instead of majority
Consensus logic needs refactoring to count ranking patterns and detect majority support (≥50%+1)

existing_features.title: Update LoginPage component to use bilingual translations for all text content including mission statement, feature descriptions, and button labels
Add French translations for all LoginPage text strings to the translations system, ensuring complete parity with English content

new_feature_requests.summary: Fix consensus detection to use majority agreement (≥50%+1) instead of requiring 100% agreement
Make homepage/landing page fully bilingual (French and English)
